unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss the Biryani! (of Deals!)
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss the Biryani! (of Deals!)

unnormalised: Hey there, fellow shopaholics! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you see a countdown timer ticking on your favourite online store? That's the magic of a flash sale! These aren't your regular Diwali discounts; they're speed demons in the world of retail.
normalised: Hey there, fellow shopaholics! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you see a countdown timer ticking on your favourite online store? That's the magic of a flash sale! These aren't your regular Diwali discounts; they're speed demons in the world of retail.

unnormalised: Imagine you're at a bustling Chandni Chowk market. Everyone's vying for the best bargain, and the vendors are practically yelling out their rock-bottom prices... but only for the next hour! That's essentially what a flash sale is, but happening on your phone screen.
normalised: Imagine you're at a bustling Chandni Chowk market. Everyone's vying for the best bargain, and the vendors are practically yelling out their rock-bottom prices... but only for the next hour! That's essentially what a flash sale is, but happening on your phone screen.

unnormalised: So, why are flash sales so effective in the Indian e-commerce scene? Well, FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) is a powerful emotion! Think about it. You've been eyeing that fancy new saree from Fabindia for weeks. Suddenly, it's 40% off for just 6 hours! You don't want to be the only one missing out, right? Next thing you know, you're adding it to your cart faster than you can say "Paneer Butter Masala."

unnormalised: Retailers love flash sales because they create urgency and clear out old inventory quickly. Think of that godown filled with last season’s kurtas that needs emptying before Onam rolls around! It’s a win-win – the customer gets a great deal, and the retailer gets to make space for new products.

unnormalised: But before you go credit card crazy, a word of caution from your friendly neighbourhood blogger! Always compare prices before you commit. Sometimes, what looks like a "50% off!" might actually be just a slight reduction on an inflated price. Do your research, friends! Check the same item on other sites, like Myntra or even good ol' Amazon.

Check the same item on other sites, like Myntra or even good ol' Amazon.

unnormalised: Also, remember to check the fine print. Are there any hidden shipping charges? What about the return policy? Nobody wants to end up with a beautiful, discounted item that doesn’t fit and can't be returned.

unnormalised: So, next time you see a flash sale pop up, take a deep breath, assess your needs, and then, if the deal is truly worth it, go for it! Happy shopping and may your wallets (and stomachs, filled with delicious biryani) be full! Remember that flash sale I told you about had that saree for Rs. 1500, which originally cost Rs. 2800! And shipping was just Rs. 50!
